IntroductionÂ¶

Gene fusion is a common type of somatic alterations that plays an important role in tumorgenesis. Well-known examples include the intra-chromosomal TMPRSS2-ERG fusions in prostate cancer, and the inter-chromosomal BCR-ABL fusions in chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML). Next generation sequencing technologies especially RNA-seq enables the genome-wide detection of gene fusions with high sensitivity. To date, most recurrent gene fusions in common cancers have been identified and various gene fusion databases have been built:

  • COSMIC

  • FusionGDB

  • FusionHub

  • ChimerDB

  • TumorFusions

FusionVet (Fusion Visualization and Evaluation Tool) is

FusionVet
